SEARCH
Package org.opengrok.indexer.configuration

Class RuntimeEnvironment

java.lang.Object
org.opengrok.indexer.configuration.RuntimeEnvironment
public final class RuntimeEnvironment extends Object
The RuntimeEnvironment class is used as a placeholder for the current configuration this execution context (classloader) is using.

    • getPathRelativeToSourceRoot

      public String getPathRelativeToSourceRoot(File file) throws IOException, ForbiddenSymlinkException
      Returns a path relative to source root. This would just be a simple substring operation, except we need to support symlinks outside the source root.
      Parameters:
      file - A file to resolve
      Returns:
      Path relative to source root
      Throws:
      IOException - If an IO error occurs
      FileNotFoundException - if the file is not relative to source root or if sourceRoot is not defined
      ForbiddenSymlinkException - if symbolic-link checking encounters an ineligible link

      public String getCtags()
      Gets the name of the ctags program to use: either the last value passed successfully to setCtags(java.lang.String), or Configuration.getCtags(), or the system property for "org.opengrok.indexer.analysis.Ctags", or "ctags" as a default.
      Returns:
      a defined value

    • setCtags

      public void setCtags(String ctags)
      Sets the name of the ctags program to use, or resets to use the fallbacks documented for getCtags().

      N.b. the value is not mediated to Configuration.

      Parameters:
      ctags - a defined value or null to reset to use the Configuration.getCtags() fallbacks
      See Also:
      • getCtags()

      a defined instance or null

    • getSuperIndexSearcher

      public SuperIndexSearcher getSuperIndexSearcher(File file) throws IOException
      Get IndexSearcher for given project or global IndexSearcher. Wrapper of getSuperIndexSearcher(String). Make sure to release the returned SuperIndexSearcher instance.
      Parameters:
      file - file object
      Returns:
      SuperIndexSearcher instance
      Throws:
      IOException - on error when reading

    • getSuperIndexSearcher

      public SuperIndexSearcher getSuperIndexSearcher(String searcherName) throws IOException
      Get IndexSearcher for given project or global IndexSearcher. Each IndexSearcher is born from a SearcherManager object. There is one SearcherManager for every project. This schema makes it possible to reuse IndexSearcher/IndexReader objects so the heavy lifting (esp. system calls) performed in FSDirectory and DirectoryReader happens only once for given index.

      The caller has to make sure that the IndexSearcher is returned to the SearcherManager. This is done with searcherManagerInstance.release(indexSearcherInstance); The return of the IndexSearcher should happen only after the search result data are read fully.

      Parameters:
      searcherName - project name or empty string for project-less configuration
      Returns:
      SuperIndexSearcher instance
      Throws:
      IOException - I/O exception

    • refreshSearcherManagerMap

      public void refreshSearcherManagerMap()
      After new configuration is put into place, the set of projects might change, so we go through the SearcherManager objects and close those where the corresponding project is no longer present.

    • getMultiReader

      public org.apache.lucene.index.MultiReader getMultiReader(SortedSet<String> projects, List<SuperIndexSearcher> searcherList)
      Return collection of IndexReader objects as MultiReader object for given list of projects. The caller is responsible for releasing the SuperIndexSearcher objects.
      Parameters:
      projects - list of projects
      searcherList - each SuperIndexSearcher produced will be put into this list
      Returns:
      MultiReader for the projects

      public <R> R syncReadConfiguration(Function<Configuration,R> function)

      Parameters:
      function - a defined function
      Returns:
      the function result

    • syncWriteConfiguration

      public <V> void syncWriteConfiguration(V v, ConfigurationValueConsumer<V> consumer)
      Performs the specified operation which is provided the runtime configuration and the specified argument, after first having obtained the configuration write-lock (and releasing afterward).
      Type Parameters:
      V - the type of the input to the operation
      Parameters:
      v - the input argument
      consumer - a defined consumer
